en: I love learning foreign languages. In fact, I love it so much that I like to learn a new language every two years, currently working on my eighth one.
zh: 我喜欢学习外语。事实上,我太喜欢学习了,以至于我想每两年就学会一门新语言,目前正在学习我的第八门语言。

en: When people find that out about me, they always ask me, "How do you do that? What's your secret?"
zh: 当人们发现这一点时,他们总是问我:"你是怎么做到的?你的秘密是什么?"

en: And to be honest, for many years, my answer would be, "I don't know. I simply love learning languages." But people were never happy with that answer.
zh: 老实说,多年来我的回答一直是:"我不知道。我只是喜欢学习语言。"但人们从来都不满意这个答案。

en: They wanted to know why they are spending years trying to learn even one language, never achieving fluency, and here I come, learning one language after another.
zh: 他们想知道为什么他们花了好几年时间试图学习哪怕一门语言,却从未达到流利程度,而我却一个接一个地学习语言。

en: They wanted to know the secret of polyglots, people who speak a lot of languages.
zh: 他们想知道通晓多种语言的人的秘密,也就是那些会说很多种语言的人。

en: And that made me wonder, too, how do actually other polyglots do it? What do we have in common?
zh: 这也让我开始思考,其他通晓多种语言的人实际上是怎么做到的?我们有什么共同点?

en: And what is it that enables us to learn languages so much faster than other people?
zh: 究竟是什么使我们能够比其他人快得多的速度学习语言呢?

en: I decided to meet other people like me and find that out.
zh: 我决定去见见其他像我这样的人,找出答案。

en: The best place to meet a lot of polyglots is an event where hundreds of language lovers meet in one place to practice their languages.
zh: 遇见大量通晓多种语言的人的最佳场所,是一个让数百名语言爱好者聚集在一个地方练习语言的活动。

en: There are several such polyglot events organized all around the world, and so I decided to go there and ask polyglots about the methods that they use.
zh: 世界各地都会举办这样的多语言学习者活动,所以我决定去那里,向他们询问他们所使用的方法。

en: And so I met Benny from Ireland, who told me that his method is to start speaking from day one.
zh: 于是我遇到了来自爱尔兰的Benny,他告诉我说他的方法是从第一天就开始开口说。

en: He learns a few phrases from a travel phrasebook and goes to meet native speakers and starts having conversations with them right away.
zh: 他从旅游短语手册中学了几句短语,然后去见母语人士,立即开始与他们对话。

en: He doesn't mind making even 200 mistakes a day, because that's how he learns, based on the feedback.
zh: 他不在乎一天犯200个错误,因为这就是他学习的方式,通过反馈来学习。

en: And the best thing is, he doesn't even need to travel a lot today, because you can easily have conversations with native speakers from the comfort of your living room, using websites.
zh: 最棒的是,如今他甚至不需要频繁旅行,因为你可以通过网站,在自家客厅的舒适环境中轻松与母语人士对话。

en: I also met Lucas from Brazil who had a really interesting method to learn Russian.
zh: 我还遇到了来自巴西的Lucas,他有一个学习俄语的非常有趣的方法。

en: He simply added a hundred random Russian speakers on Skype as friends, and then he opened a chat window with one of them and wrote "Hi" in Russian.
zh: 他简单地在Skype上随机添加了一百个俄罗斯人为好友,然后打开了其中一个人的聊天窗口,用俄语写了"嗨"。

en: And the person replied, "Hi, how are you?"
zh: 对方回复道:"嗨,你好吗?"

en: Lucas copied this and put it into a text window with another person, and the person replied, "I'm fine, thank you, and how are you?"
zh: Lucas复制了这个内容并发给另一个人,那人回复说:"我很好,谢谢,你好吗?"

en: Lucas copied this back to the first person, and in this way, he had two strangers have a conversation with each other without knowing about it.
zh: Lucas把这个内容复制给第一个人,就这样,他让两个陌生人彼此交谈,而他们却不知道发生了什么。

en: And soon he would start typing himself, because he had so many of these conversations that he figured out how the Russian conversation usually starts.
zh: 很快他就开始自己打字了,因为他进行了这么多对话,已经搞清楚俄语对话通常是如何开始的。

en: What an ingenious method, right?
zh: 多么巧妙的方法,对吧?

en: And then I met polyglots who always start by imitating sounds of the language, and others who always learn the 500 most frequent words of the language, and yet others who always start by reading about the grammar.
zh: 然后我遇到了一些总是从模仿语言声音开始的多语言学习者,还有一些人总是先学习语言中最常用的500个单词,还有一些人总是从阅读语法开始。

en: If I asked a hundred different polyglots, I heard a hundred different approaches to learning languages.
zh: 如果我询问一百个不同的多语言学习者,我会听到一百种不同的语言学习方法。

en: Everybody seems to have a unique way they learn a language, and yet we all come to the same result of speaking several languages fluently.
zh: 每个人似乎都有自己独特的语言学习方式,但我们都能达到同样的结果——流利地说多种语言。

en: And as I was listening to these polyglots telling me about their methods, it suddenly dawned on me: the one thing we all have in common is that we simply found ways to enjoy the language-learning process.
zh: 当我听这些多语言学习者讲述他们的方法时,我突然意识到:我们唯一的共同点就是,我们都找到了享受语言学习过程的方法。

en: All of these polyglots were talking about language learning as if it was great fun.
zh: 所有这些多语言学习者谈论语言学习时,都好像这是一件非常有趣的事情。

en: You should have seen their faces when they were showing me their colorful grammar charts and their carefully handmade flash cards, and their statistics about learning vocabulary using apps, or even how they love to cook based on recipes in a foreign language.
zh: 你应该看看他们的表情,当他们向我展示他们五颜六色的语法图表、精心制作的抽认卡、使用应用程序学习词汇的统计数据,甚至他们多么喜欢用外语菜谱做饭时。

en: All of them use different methods, but they always make sure it's something that they personally enjoy.
zh: 他们使用不同的方法,但他们总是确保这是他们个人喜欢的方式。

en: I realized that this is actually how I learn languages myself.
zh: 我意识到这实际上就是我自己学习语言的方式。

en: When I was learning Spanish, I was bored with the text in the textbook.
zh: 当我学习西班牙语时,我对教科书中的文本感到厌烦。

en: I mean, who wants to read about Jose asking about the directions to the train station. Right?
zh: 我是说,谁想阅读关于José询问去火车站怎么走的内容。对吧?

en: I wanted to read "Harry Potter" instead, because that was my favorite book as a child, and I have read it many times.
zh: 我想读《哈利·波特》,因为那是我童年时最喜欢的书,而且我已经读过很多遍了。

en: So I got the Spanish translation of "Harry Potter" and started reading, and sure enough, I didn't understand almost anything at the beginning, but I kept on reading because I loved the book, and by the end of the book, I was able to follow it almost without any problems.
zh: 所以我找来了《哈利·波特》的西班牙语译本开始阅读,果然,起初我几乎什么都不懂,但我继续读下去,因为我喜欢这本书,到书结束时,我已经几乎能够毫无障碍地理解它了。

en: And the same thing happened when I was learning German.
zh: 当我学习德语时,也发生了同样的事情。

en: I decided to watch "Friends," my favorite sitcom, in German, and again, at the beginning it was all just gibberish.
zh: 我决定用德语看我最喜欢的情景喜剧《老友记》,同样,起初一切都是乱七八糟的。

en: I didn't know where one word finished and another one started, but I kept on watching every day because it's "Friends."
zh: 我不知道一个词在哪里结束,另一个词从哪里开始,但我每天继续观看,因为这是《老友记》。

en: I can watch it in any language. I love it so much.
zh: 我可以用任何语言观看。我太喜欢它了。

en: And after the second or third season, seriously, the dialogue started to make sense.
zh: 在看完第二季或第三季后,说真的,对话开始变得有意义了。

en: I only realized this after meeting other polyglots.
zh: 我只有在遇到其他多语言学习者后才意识到这一点。

en: We are no geniuses and we have no shortcut to learning languages.
zh: 我们不是天才,我们也没有学习语言的捷径。

en: We simply found ways how to enjoy the process, how to turn language learning from a boring school subject into a pleasant activity which you don't mind doing every day.
zh: 我们只是找到了享受过程的方法,如何将语言学习从枯燥的学校科目转变为一种你不介意每天进行的愉快活动。

en: If you don't like writing words down on paper, you can always type them in an app.
zh: 如果你不喜欢在纸上写字,你总是可以在应用程序中打字。

en: If you don't like listening to boring textbook material, find interesting content on YouTube or in podcasts for any language.
zh: 如果你不喜欢听枯燥的教科书材料,可以在YouTube或播客中为任何语言找到有趣的内容。

en: If you're a more introverted person and you can't imagine speaking to native speakers right away, you can apply the method of self-talk.
zh: 如果你是一个更内向的人,无法想象立即与母语人士交谈,你可以使用自言自语的方法。

en: You can talk to yourself in the comfort of your room, describing your plans for the weekend, how your day has been, or even take a random picture from your phone and describe the picture to your imaginary friend.
zh: 你可以在自己房间的舒适环境中与自己对话,描述你的周末计划、你的一天过得如何,或者甚至从手机中随机选择一张照片,向你的想象中的朋友描述这张照片。

en: This is how polyglots learn languages, and the best news is, it's available to anyone who is willing to take the learning into their own hands.
zh: 这就是多语言学习者学习语言的方式,最好的消息是,任何人都可以做到,只要他们愿意把学习掌握在自己手中。

en: So meeting other polyglots helped me realize that it is really crucial to find enjoyment in the process of learning languages, but also that joy in itself is not enough.
zh: 所以与其他多语言学习者见面让我意识到,在语言学习过程中找到乐趣真的很重要,但光有乐趣是不够的。

en: If you want to achieve fluency in a foreign language, you'll also need to apply three more principles.
zh: 如果你想在外语中达到流利程度,你还需要应用另外三个原则。

en: First of all, you'll need effective methods.
zh: 首先,你需要有效的方法。

en: If you try to memorize a list of words for a test tomorrow, the words will be stored in your short-term memory and you'll forget them after a few days.
zh: 如果你试图为了明天的考试而记住一列单词,这些单词将存储在你的短期记忆中,几天后你就会忘记它们。

en: If you, however, want to keep words long term, you need to revise them in the course of a few days repeatedly using the so-called space repetition.
zh: 然而,如果你想长期记住单词,你需要在几天内反复复习,使用所谓的间隔重复法。

en: You can use apps which are based on this system such as Anki or Memrise, or you can write lists of word in a notebook using the Goldlist method, which is also very popular with many polyglots.
zh: 你可以使用基于这个系统的应用程序,如Anki或Memrise,或者你可以使用Goldlist方法在笔记本中写下单词列表,这种方法也很受许多多语言学习者的欢迎。

en: If you're not sure which methods are effective and what is available out there, just check out polyglots' YouTube channels and websites and get inspiration from them.
zh: 如果你不确定哪些方法是有效的,以及外面有哪些可用资源,只需查看多语言学习者的YouTube频道和网站,从中获取灵感。

en: If it works for them, it will most probably work for you too.
zh: 如果对他们有效,很可能对你也有效。

en: The third principle to follow is to create a system in your learning.
zh: 要遵循的第三个原则是在你的学习中建立一个系统。

en: We're all very busy and no one really has time to learn a language today.
zh: 我们都很忙,如今没有人真正有时间学习语言。

en: But we can create that time if we just plan a bit ahead.
zh: 但如果我们提前规划,就能创造出时间。

en: Can you wake up 15 minutes earlier than you normally do? That would be the perfect time to revise some vocabulary.
zh: 你能比平时早起15分钟吗?那将是复习一些词汇的绝佳时间。

en: Can you listen to a podcast on your way to work while driving? Well, that would be great to get some listening experience.
zh: 你能在开车上班的路上听播客吗?那将是获得听力体验的好方法。

en: There are so many things we can do without even planning that extra time, such as listening to podcasts on our way to work or doing our household chores.
zh: 我们可以在无需额外规划时间的情况下做很多事,比如在上班路上听播客或做家务。

en: The important thing is to create a plan in the learning.
zh: 重要的是在学习中制定计划。

en: "I will practice speaking every Tuesday and Thursday with a friend for 20 minutes. I will listen to a YouTube video while having breakfast."
zh: "我将在每周二和周四与朋友练习口语20分钟。我将在吃早餐时听YouTube视频。"

en: If you create a system in your learning, you don't need to find that extra time, because it will become a part of your everyday life.
zh: 如果你在学习中建立了系统,你就不需要额外的时间,因为它会成为你日常生活的一部分。

en: And finally, if you want to learn a language fluently, you need also a bit of patience.
zh: 最后,如果你想流利地学习一门语言,你还需要一点耐心。

en: It's not possible to learn a language within two months, but it's definitely possible to make a visible improvement in two months, if you learn in small chunks every day in a way that you enjoy.
zh: 在两个月内学会一门语言是不可能的,但如果每天以你喜欢的方式学习一小部分,两个月内肯定可以看到明显的进步。

en: And there is nothing that motivates us more than our own success.
zh: 没有什么比我们自己的成功更能激励我们了。

en: I vividly remember the moment when I understood the first joke in German when watching "Friends."
zh: 我清楚地记得当我看《老友记》时第一次听懂德语笑话的那一刻。

en: I was so happy and motivated that I just kept on watching that day two more episodes, and as I kept watching, I had more and more of those moments of understanding, these little victories, and step by step, I got to a level where I could use the language freely and fluently to express anything.
zh: 我是如此快乐和充满动力,那天我又看了两集,随着我继续观看,我越来越多地经历了这些理解的时刻,这些小小的胜利,一步一步地,我达到了一个可以自由流利地使用语言表达任何事物的水平。

en: This is a wonderful feeling. I can't get enough of that feeling, and that's why I learn a language every two years.
zh: 这是一种美妙的感觉。我对这种感觉永远不嫌够,这就是为什么我每两年都学习一门语言。

en: So this is the whole polyglot secret.
zh: 这就是多语言学习者的全部秘密。

en: Find effective methods which you can use systematically over the period of some time in a way which you enjoy, and this is how polyglots learn languages within months, not years.
zh: 找到有效的方法,你可以系统地在一段时间内以你喜欢的方式使用它们,这就是多语言学习者如何在数月而不是数年内学习语言的方法。

en: Now, some of you may be thinking, "That's all very nice to enjoy language learning, but isn't the real secret that you polyglots are just super talented and most of us aren't?"
zh: 现在,你们中的一些人可能在想,"享受语言学习当然很好,但真正的秘密是不是你们多语言学习者都超级有天赋,而我们大多数人都不是呢?"

en: Well, there's one thing I haven't told you about Benny and Lucas.
zh: 嗯,有一件事我还没有告诉你们关于Benny和Lucas的事。

en: Benny had 11 years of Irish Gaelic and five years of German at school.
zh: Benny在学校学习了11年爱尔兰盖尔语和5年德语。

en: He couldn't speak them at all when graduating.
zh: 他毕业时根本不会说这些语言。

en: Up to the age of 21, he thought he didn't have the language gene and he could not speak another language.
zh: 直到21岁,他都认为自己没有语言天赋,无法说另一种语言。

en: Then he started to look for his way of learning languages, which was speaking to native speakers and getting feedback from them, and today Benny can easily have a conversation in 10 languages.
zh: 然后他开始寻找自己的语言学习方法,那就是与母语人士交谈并从他们那里获得反馈,如今Benny可以轻松地用10种语言对话。

en: Lucas tried to learn English at school for 10 years.
zh: Lucas在学校尝试学习英语10年。

en: He was one of the worst students in class.
zh: 他是班上最差的学生之一。

en: His friends even made fun of him and gave him a Russian textbook as a joke because they thought he would never learn that language, or any language.
zh: 他的朋友甚至嘲笑他,送给他一本俄语教科书作为玩笑,因为他们认为他永远学不会那种语言,或任何语言。

en: And then Lucas started to experiment with methods, looking for his own way to learn, for example, by having Skype chat conversations with strangers.
zh: 然后Lucas开始实验各种方法,寻找自己的学习方式,例如,与陌生人进行Skype聊天对话。

en: And after just 10 years, Lucas is able to speak 11 languages fluently.
zh: 仅仅10年后,Lucas就能流利地说11种语言了。

en: Does that sound like a miracle?
zh: 这听起来像奇迹吗?

en: Well, I see such miracles every single day.
zh: 嗯,我每天都看到这样的奇迹。

en: As a language mentor, I help people learn languages by themselves, and I see this every day.
zh: 作为一名语言导师,我帮助人们自学语言,我每天都看到这种情况。

en: People struggle with language learning for five, 10, even 20 years, and then they suddenly take their learning into their own hands, start using materials which they enjoy, more effective methods, or they start tracking their learning so that they can appreciate their own progress, and that's when suddenly they magically find the language talent that they were missing all their lives.
zh: 人们在语言学习上挣扎了5年、10年甚至20年,然后他们突然把学习掌握在自己手中,开始使用他们喜欢的材料和更有效的方法,或者他们开始跟踪自己的学习,这样他们就可以欣赏自己的进步,就在那时,他们神奇地发现自己一生中缺失的语言天赋。

en: So if you've also tried to learn a language and you gave up, thinking it's too difficult or you don't have the language talent, give it another try.
zh: 所以如果你也尝试过学习一门语言但放弃了,认为太难了或者你没有语言天赋,再试一次吧。

en: Maybe you're also just one enjoyable method away from learning that language fluently.
zh: 也许你离流利地学习那门语言只差一个令人愉快的方法。

en: Maybe you're just one method away from becoming a polyglot.
zh: 也许你离成为一名多语言学习者只差一个方法。
